channel.title: Looking to purchase a PC ~800-1,000 USD
channel.description: Could someone please direct me to a New Egg Desktop PC that focuses on gaming, within the price range of around 800 to 1,000 USD? I would build my own but I have no idea what I'm doing nor do I have anyone around me who does either.

item.title: Looking to purchase a PC ~800-1,000 USD
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:53, topic:521718”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=640231.msg4320078#msg4320078 date=1372109459]
edit: found a combo for a better board

http://pcpartpicker.com/p/1a9Lv
[/quote]
This I approve of the 3570k is a damn good CPU. Only nick is the slow RAM again, maybe get a slightly cheaper case and get 1600Mhz.[/quote]that was already a hell cheap case I don’t think it would be possible to get 8gb in a 1600 with the budget sadly but alas ill do some more tweaking tomorrow while at work (my build is saved on there )
I could most likely use an micro atx case but I like to go with the larger stuff personally.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking to purchase a PC ~800-1,000 USD

item.title: Looking to purchase a PC ~800-1,000 USD
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:50, topic:521718”]^ cause there isn’t anything wrong with micro atx at this budget level

@the posted link above ew… graphic card by itself makes that a horrible build. At this budget level an i5 is plenty really you could probably get away with a high level i3/lower i5 but i53570/3750k is pretty awesome so meh

made this just a few minutes ago my goal was a 1k$ - budget using a 770

http://pcpartpicker.com/p/19NQg

…not satisfied with the i3 but it was the best I could do to keep it under the 1k$ point[/quote]
i3 would be a major bottleneck to the gtx 770… plus who even needs a dvd drive anymore, nevermind a blu-ray player?
I just have a single £15 external usb dvd drive and I use it for all my PCs, discs will likely be phased out pretty soon anyway.

Also, slow RAM.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to purchase a PC ~800-1,000 USD
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:48, topic:521718”]This is a pretty good buy for what’s in it:

newegg.com

Lenovo Desktop PC K430 (57308925) Intel Core i7 3770 (3.40 GHz)...

Buy Lenovo Desktop PC K430 (57308925) Intel Core i7 3770 (3.40 GHz) 12 GB DDR3 2 TB HDD NVIDIA GeForce GT 640 2GB Windows 8 with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

Edit: Was looking at some of the reviews for it on Newegg, and majority of them were about where the USB ports were located and how many there are on it.[/quote]
Bad graphics card, overall build is a bit expensive considering what you could put together for the same price.

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:47, topic:521718”]So I was playing with a few setups this morning and this one is actually pretty nice(and I love the case)

http://pcpartpicker.com/p/183Vt

keep in mind you need your own optical drives/os[/quote]
Why micro ATX?

item.title: Looking to purchase a PC ~800-1,000 USD
item.dc:creator: @ArmorCroc ArmorCroc
item.description:
@ArmorCroc wrote:

As someone on the first page had found: http://www.bestbuy.com/site/iBUYPOWER±+Desktop±+8GB+Memory±+500GB+Hard+Drive/6979905.p?id=1218818468032&skuId=6979905#tab=specifications

That thing is quite good if you think it’s just a lil’ more then 600€! It just made me wonder: what can you do to overload the GTX 650 with the i5 this thing has!? I bought this PB pre-built IPower x3.0 or whatevs’ and later on added in a GTX 560 ti. Had this i7 and 6Gb RAM and mehh, when good drivers finally came from the green company (Nvidia) I had this beast kill the rest of the computer by just spinning one fanblade at them… At that point I was amused to testing the inbuilt “System Performance test” of Windows 7, everything maxed except for the HDD speed which was the basic 5.9, thus ruining my score. In Win 8 Pro I find the requirements for max specs simply insane! Clocked my 16Gb RAM on my new machine (I call her “The Weed Scythe”.) to 2400 Mhz and it gives me 8.0 from RAM! Does even Google have CPU or RAM to fulfil the requirements!?

Read full topic
item.source: Looking to purchase a PC ~800-1,000 USD

[/quote]
wooo ty, btw don’t I need to buy Windows 7 or 8 as well if I’m not buying a prebuilt PC?[/quote]Indeed. Buy Windows 7.

item.title: Looking to purchase a PC ~800-1,000 USD
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:38, topic:521718”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=640231.msg4316545#msg4316545 date=1371582055]

Do you already have a monitor you’re going to use? If so, what interface does it use?

Holy crap, no x.x Help me! What Monitor should I get if I get that setup O_O. Actually, couldn’t I set up an HDMI cable to view it on my TV?

yes you can.
[/quote]
^This.

But, if you need a real monitor (which I suggest), you’ll need to do some major cutbacks on some parts.[/quote]
If you’re talking about cutting it to fit the budget, then don’t worry about that I would consider that separate from my actual build.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to purchase a PC ~800-1,000 USD
item.dc:creator: @Cyberus Cyberus
item.description:
@Cyberus wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:31, topic:521718”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=640231.msg4316462#msg4316462 date=1371569070]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=640231.msg4316406#msg4316406 date=1371559490]

[quote author=Elrick link=topic=640231.msg4316405#msg4316405 date=1371559090]

http://pcpartpicker.com/user/Rabrg/saved/1LJJ , I am very intrigued in this setup. Can someone else look at this and say whether it is as good as it seems, and if anything else needs to be added? I don’t really need a DVD driver or anything like that, as I still have a Laptop for that stuff, it’s mainly for playing games and buying them off steam.
[/quote]don’t be fooled the 4th generation products aren’t worth it yet they will lower price.

What do you mean 4th gen products? I am an utter noob at this :s
[/quote]see the i5-4570 or whatever? the 4 there symbolizes it’s a 4th generation. The 3rd gen one which I would personally suggest is a i5-3570k

So you’re saying 3rd gen is nearly on par with 4th? I don’t want to have to update my system again in a year or so.
[/quote]I’m just saying for 100$ more it isn’t worth it. The 4th gen according to the benchmarks are only about 10% better than the current 3rd generation versions[/quote]
umm… it’s not even a $30 difference, far less $100

Read full topic
